name: Corn Salad With Tomatoes, Feta and Mint
description: Fresh raw corn shucked from the cob is ideal here. The juice from the tomatoes delivers just the right amount of acidity, so there’s no need for vinegar. Eat this as is, by the bowl, or toss it with cooked rice or beans for a more filling meal — you’ll want to add oil and vinegar accordingly. In midsummer, with peak-season produce, there is nothing better.
recipeCategory: dinner, lunch, quick, salads and dressings, vegetables
keywords: corn, feta, mint, tomatoes, main course, side dish, vegetarian
recipeIngredient: 2 to 3 cups raw or cooked corn kernels (from 4 to 6 ears)
1 large or 2 medium ripe tomatoes, cut into fairly small pieces
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Put the corn, tomatoes, cheese and mint in a medium bowl. Drizzle with the olive oil and toss to coat.
Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve.
